db:abstract.db:para: The QCryptographicHash class provides a way to generate cryptographic hashes.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QCryptographicHash can be used to generate cryptographic hashes of binary or text data.
Refer to the documentation of the QCryptographicHash::Algorithm enum for a list of the supported algorithms.

db:note.db:para: In Qt versions before 5.9, when asked to generate a SHA3 hash sum, QCryptographicHash actually calculated Keccak. If you need compatibility with SHA-3 hashes produced by those versions of Qt, use the Keccak_ enumerators. Alternatively, if source compatibility is required, define the macro QT_SHA3_KECCAK_COMPAT.

db:td.db:para: Generate an MD4 hash sum
Generate an MD5 hash sum
Generate an SHA-1 hash sum
Generate an SHA-224 hash sum (SHA-2). Introduced in Qt 5.0
Generate an SHA-256 hash sum (SHA-2). Introduced in Qt 5.0
Generate an SHA-384 hash sum (SHA-2). Introduced in Qt 5.0
Generate an SHA-512 hash sum (SHA-2). Introduced in Qt 5.0
Generate an SHA3-224 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 5.1
Generate an SHA3-256 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 5.1
Generate an SHA3-384 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 5.1
Generate an SHA3-512 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 5.1
Generate a Keccak-224 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 5.9.2
Generate a Keccak-256 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 5.9.2
Generate a Keccak-384 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 5.9.2
Generate a Keccak-512 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 5.9.2
Generate a BLAKE2b-160 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 6.0
Generate a BLAKE2b-256 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 6.0
Generate a BLAKE2b-384 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 6.0
Generate a BLAKE2b-512 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 6.0
Generate a BLAKE2s-128 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 6.0
Generate a BLAKE2s-160 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 6.0
Generate a BLAKE2s-224 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 6.0
Generate a BLAKE2s-256 hash sum. Introduced in Qt 6.0

db:section.db:title: [static noexcept, since 6.8] QByteArrayView QCryptographicHash::hashInto(QSpan<char> buffer, QByteArrayView data, QCryptographicHash::Algorithm method)
db:section.db:bridgehead: [static noexcept, since 6.8] QByteArrayView QCryptographicHash::hashInto(QSpan<char> buffer, QSpan<const QByteArrayView> data, QCryptographicHash::Algorithm method)
[static noexcept, since 6.8] QByteArrayView QCryptographicHash::hashInto(QSpan<std::byte> buffer, QByteArrayView data, QCryptographicHash::Algorithm method)
[static noexcept, since 6.8] QByteArrayView QCryptographicHash::hashInto(QSpan<std::byte> buffer, QSpan<const QByteArrayView> data, QCryptographicHash::Algorithm method)
[static noexcept, since 6.8] QByteArrayView QCryptographicHash::hashInto(QSpan<uchar> buffer, QByteArrayView data, QCryptographicHash::Algorithm method)
[static noexcept, since 6.8] QByteArrayView QCryptographicHash::hashInto(QSpan<uchar> buffer, QSpan<const QByteArrayView> data, QCryptographicHash::Algorithm method)
db:section.db:para: Returns the hash of data using method, using buffer to store the result.
If data is a span, adds all the byte array views to the hash, in the order given.
The return value will be a sub-span of buffer, unless buffer is of insufficient size, in which case a null QByteArrayView is returned.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QCryptographicHash::QCryptographicHash(QCryptographicHash::Algorithm method)
db:section.db:para: Constructs an object that can be used to create a cryptographic hash from data using method.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.5] QCryptographicHash::QCryptographicHash(QCryptographicHash &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move-constructs a new QCryptographicHash from other.

db:note.db:para: The moved-from object other is placed in a partially-formed state, in which the only valid operations are destruction and assignment of a new value.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QCryptographicHash::~QCryptographicHash()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the object.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] void QCryptographicHash::addData(QByteArrayView bytes)
db:section.db:para: Adds the characters in bytes to the cryptographic hash.

db:note.db:para: In Qt versions prior to 6.3, this function took QByteArray, not QByteArrayView.

db:section.db:title: bool QCryptographicHash::addData(QIODevice *device)
db:section.db:para: Reads the data from the open QIODevice device until it ends and hashes it. Returns true if reading was successful.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.5] QCryptographicHash::Algorithm QCryptographicHash::algorithm() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the algorithm used to generate the cryptographic hash.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: [static] QByteArray QCryptographicHash::hash(QByteArrayView data, QCryptographicHash::Algorithm method)
db:section.db:para: Returns the hash of data using method.

db:note.db:para: In Qt versions prior to 6.3, this function took QByteArray, not QByteArrayView.

db:section.db:title: [static] int QCryptographicHash::hashLength(QCryptographicHash::Algorithm method)
db:section.db:para: Returns the size of the output of the selected hash method in bytes.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] void QCryptographicHash::reset()
db:section.db:para: Resets the object.

db:section.db:title: QByteArray QCryptographicHash::result() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the final hash value.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.3] QByteArrayView QCryptographicHash::resultView() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the final hash value.
Note that the returned view remains valid only as long as the QCryptographicHash object is not modified by other means.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.3.

db:section.db:title: [static, since 6.5] bool QCryptographicHash::supportsAlgorithm(QCryptographicHash::Algorithm method)
db:section.db:para: Returns whether the selected algorithm method is supported and if result() will return a value when the method is used.

db:note.db:para: OpenSSL will be responsible for providing this information when used as a provider, otherwise true will be returned as the non-OpenSSL implementation doesn't have any restrictions. We return false if we fail to query OpenSSL.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.5] void QCryptographicHash::swap(QCryptographicHash &other)
db:section.db:para: Swaps this cryptographic hash with other. This operation is very fast and never fails.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.5] QCryptographicHash &QCryptographicHash::operator=(QCryptographicHash &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move-assigns other to this QCryptographicHash instance.

db:note.db:para: The moved-from object other is placed in a partially-formed state, in which the only valid operations are destruction and assignment of a new value.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.5.

db:section.db:title: Obsolete Members for QCryptographicHash
db:section.db:para: The following members of class QCryptographicHash are deprecated. We strongly advise against using them in new code.

db:section.db:title: [deprecated] void QCryptographicHash::addData(const char *data, qsizetype length)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
Adds the first length chars of data to the cryptographic hash.
Use the QByteArrayView overload instead.
